reviews.text: Calm and interesting place in the middle of the chaos that is that part of Freetown.

This museum is an emerging gem. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. It is great what they are doing with very limited resources. Well worth the effort of searching this museum out!  If you make it there, you are two block away from the old Fourah Bay College building which is worth a quick look too!
Adds knowledge about sierra leone
Good
Until recently the only memory of the railway Sierra Leone was the carriages displayed here.
Land scape is gorgeous and the water is amazing.
Best beach...so clean

Lovely beach with peaceful ambiance. The beach is neat and not smelly; well managed. Though the road to the beach is not so smooth, so expect to go through some rough roads, but the beach is worth the journey.
Quite nice place specially during week days except weekend it gets really busy.
Very nice place, you can enjoy a full day of relaxation, the final road to get here is a little bit ruff, but it's ok. I recomand you to come with the jeep !

Came here on a Sunday, really beautiful place to chill. There was a wind which was actually nice too so it wasn't too hot. We sat on the beach chairs you can rent for 10,000 per chair, with which you'll get a table and umbrella for the group. The food was also good - fish and rice, or chicken and chips, or a combination of them was 7,000, it was tasty, and came with salad too. The beach is truly stunning and is well looked after too.
Gorgeous beach with friendly staff ergo still bring delicious fresh seafood directly to your table on the beach! Calm water and beautiful views, and relatively non-pushy craft vendors.
Very nice beach I loved the white sand
Best place to have a Sunday of relax and good sea food.

Gotta love a white sand West African beach. Very warm water, no strong currents, hard along the beach, local shopping, great vibe, always a soccer game going on, fantastic scenery with untouched mountainous jungles in the background. Nice little getaway of you're in Freetown.
Fantastic
There are scammers here demanding 'transit fees' to leave from the beach to go to banana island. These people are extortioners who have no legitimacy. Resist.
Ein wunderschöner Ort zum Entspannen mit einem herrlichen Sandstrand und einem fantastischen Blick auf die vorgelagerte Insel.
Una meraviglia

Had lunch here earlier today. The air conditioning inside here, in a hot and steamy Freetown, comes in handy. There’s also free WiFi. Food really tasted good, I’d the shrimps kebab. The only problem is the dish was a little bit oily. Other than that, everything was good. The tropical smoothie was organic and very delicious

I've eaten here a few times during my stay in Freetown. It's nice and air conditioned and card payments are accepted, which is handy. I've had the full English (lol different..) which was a nice sized portion and very tasty, I'd also recommend the fried chicken.
Had a great meal w/9 others, friends & family. Service was super and food was excellent!  I must return again on my next trip to Freetown!
Great food. Great service. My go to lunch place in Freetown.
It was indeed a crown bakery I enjoy a lot
Barracuda was tasty, a view was breathtaking. Its a pity they don't have ginger
Affordable and in good environment. Room need a bit of sprucing up
Sierre Leone is not known for its food, but this is a good place. Right on the water. I really like the barracuda.

Roy's has a great location on Lumley Beach. Best time is to get there in time to have a meal as the sun sets out to sea as you enjoy a meal from their excellent sea food options. Friendly service and options to dine inside or out on the beach deck or on the terrace.
Great views, not so great burgers. Superb Barracuda. Awful wine.
Very nice environment just next to the swimming pool. Food was delicious and service great as well. Many nice dishes but highly recommend the steak with the pepper sauce!

the hotel looks decidedly average, but the restaurant by the pool is a class above. The food in the restaurant is fantastic and considering your options for good food in Sierra Leone are limited in Freetown, this was a nice break and a way to get some fresh and delicious food.

Amazing place at the top of the mountain 
Rich food dishes at restaurant
Very good ambiance to drink and eat with a great view of sunset
Great place with a serene environment
I used to eat in this restaurant for years
Decent food, but pricey.
Nice outside terras, lebanese menu, lamb chops were a bit too hard.

Oasis in the bustle of the city. Outstanding Asian and Middle Eastern Cuisine. Enjoy the ambiance of palm trees and outdoor bar. Cakes can be ordered for events, excellent patisserie chef. Abdullah is hands on with the venue.
Nice quite place. Good kitchen. Fast service
Really nice food, amazing mint lemonade and kind staff.
Great Indian, European and fusion food. Nice outdoor terrace with bar under mature trees. Attentive and friendly service. Great place to eat.

They doing baby ear piercing here. The staff that work at the jewellery store are really friendly. They ways gave two staff to pierce baby ears as they do both at the same time to prevent added stress to the child which is perfect

Ignite Records is the best record store in the city. A real vinyl cavern that is packed with fairly priced records to suit a wide range of tastes. Rich (the owner) is a real gent, very knowledgeable and accommodating. The store is friendly and welcoming. Important we keep this indie going!
Legendary Birmingham fixture! Great place to get alternative/rock clothing and accessories  in an iconic location in the centre of town for nearly 50 years.

I have been going to Oasis for over 10 years now and every time you go in it is exciting, literally like a kid in a sweet shop. There is always something new and exciting going on. Highly recommend it!

Oasis has lost it appeal and is no longer a fashion markets. It's now full of rude and over priced tattoo parlours and pretentious "clothing shops". Not to mention the shops selling drug paraphernalia. 

Both inside and out the markets are rundown and are stuck in the 1980s and is in need of updating and bring in to this millennium. 
The markets also attracts the wrong kind of people and is a center of anti-social behaviour. I have often seen the police and security patrolling and moving people on. 

The Oasis markets are full of empty stalls and shops, which adds to the rundown feeling.

In conclusion, I would not recommend visting the markets for this reason.

One of my favorite Thai restaurants in Berlin. Food is awesome at good prices. Great choice, mostly crowded (because so good), so you should better make a reservation, especially at the evening / weekend
If one loves Thai food, this is the place to go. I recommend the papaya salad

I have such a wonderful experience at the restaurant. The food is really authentic and definitely "zab". If you are craving for Thai food, this is the place to come. I recommend slow-cooked pork noodle and Som Tum, papaya salad.
Spicy Thai food for very good price. Very tasty Tom Kha Gai. This place is bigger than the other Papaya and seem to serve more options. Great deal for a lunch in this area.

I really enjoy my food here. I ordered Pad Thay with garnelen and Ice Tea. It was really good decision! The food was soooo good!
The Rindfleischsuppe is also delicious! 
They accept card ;)
